connectorUiConfig.title: CTM360 CyberBlindSpot (Serverless)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The CTM360 Cyber Blind Spot (CBS) connector provides integration with CTM360's CBS platform to ingest security data across 6 module types: incidents, malware logs, breached credentials, compromised cards, domain infringement, and subdomain infringement. This connector uses the Codeless Connector Framework (CCF) for serverless data collection.

**Data Types:**
- CBSLog_AzureV2_CL
- CBS_MalwareLogs_AzureV2_CL
- CBS_BreachedCredentials_AzureV2_CL
- CBS_CompromisedCards_AzureV2_CL
- CBS_DomainInfringement_AzureV2_CL
- CBS_SubdomainInfringement_AzureV2_CL

sampleQueries.query:
CBSLog_AzureV2_CL
| sort by TimeGenerated desc
| take 10

CBS_MalwareLogs_AzureV2_CL
| sort by TimeGenerated desc
| take 10

CBS_BreachedCredentials_AzureV2_CL
| sort by TimeGenerated desc
| take 10

CBS_CompromisedCards_AzureV2_CL
| sort by TimeGenerated desc
| take 10

CBS_DomainInfringement_AzureV2_CL
| sort by TimeGenerated desc
| take 10

CBS_SubdomainInfringement_AzureV2_CL
| sort by TimeGenerated desc
| take 10

dataTypes.name: CBSLog_AzureV2_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CBSLog_AzureV2_CL
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: CBS_MalwareLogs_AzureV2_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CBS_MalwareLogs_AzureV2_CL
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: CBS_BreachedCredentials_AzureV2_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CBS_BreachedCredentials_AzureV2_CL
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: CBS_CompromisedCards_AzureV2_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CBS_CompromisedCards_AzureV2_CL
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: CBS_DomainInfringement_AzureV2_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CBS_DomainInfringement_AzureV2_CL
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: CBS_SubdomainInfringement_AzureV2_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CBS_SubdomainInfringement_AzureV2_CL
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

instructionSteps.title: Connect CTM360 Cyber Blind Spot to Microsoft Sentinel
instructionSteps.description: This connector uses the Codeless Connector Framework (CCF) to ingest data from CTM360 CBS into Microsoft Sentinel. Data is collected every 5 minutes across 6 different module types.

parameters.text: This connector creates 6 separate tables for different CBS module types: Incidents, Malware Logs, Breached Credentials, Compromised Cards, Domain Infringement, and Subdomain Infringement.

instructionSteps.title: Step 1: Obtain CTM360 API Keys
instructionSteps.description:
To setup this integration, you will need CBS API Key. You can get these keys using the following links:

CBS API Key found from this link: https://platform.ctm360.com/start/integrations after logging with you account

instructionSteps.title: Step 2: Configure Connection
instructionSteps.description: Enter your CTM360 CBS API key and connect to start data ingestion.

parameters.label: CTM360 CBS API Key
parameters.placeholder: Enter your CTM360 CBS API Key
parameters.name: apiKey

instructionSteps.title: Step 3: Verify Data Ingestion
instructionSteps.description: After connecting, data should start flowing within 5-10 minutes. Use the sample queries above to verify data ingestion for each module type.

parameters.text: Note: Initial data ingestion may take up to 30 minutes. The connector polls every 5 minutes with a 5-minute rolling window.

connectorUiConfig.title: CTM360 HackerView (Serverless)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The CTM360 HackerView connector enables you to ingest security issues and vulnerabilities from your HackerView External Attack Surface Management platform into Microsoft Sentinel. This serverless connector uses the REST API to automatically pull issue data for analysis and correlation with other security events.

sampleQueries.query:
HackerViewLog_AzureV2_CL
| where Severity == 'High'
| summarize count() by Category

HackerViewLog_AzureV2_CL
| where TimeGenerated > ago(24h)
| project TimeGenerated, Title, Severity, Status, Category

dataTypes.name: HackerViewLog_AzureV2_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
HackerViewLog_AzureV2_CL
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

properties.description: HackerViewLog_Parser Data Parser with template version 3.0.3

properties.query:
let HackerViewV1_Empty = datatable(
    id_s:string, title_s:string, severity_s:string, status_s:string,
    first_seen_s:string, last_seen_s:string, category_s:string, description_s:string,
    asset_name_s:string, asset_type_s:string, port_d:int, protocol_s:string,
    ip_address_s:string, technology_s:string, cve_s:string, cvss_score_d:real,
    remediation_s:string, references_s:string, tags_s:string, priority_s:string,
    assigned_to_s:string, notes_s:string, external_link_s:string,
    created_at_s:string, updated_at_s:string
)[];
let HackerViewV1_view = union isfuzzy=true HackerViewLog_Azure_1_CL, HackerViewV1_Empty
    | extend EventVendor = 'CTM360',
             EventProduct = 'HackerView',
             SourceConnector = 'FunctionApp',
             IssueId = column_ifexists('id_s', ''),
             Title = column_ifexists('title_s', ''),
             Severity = column_ifexists('severity_s', ''),
             Status = column_ifexists('status_s', ''),
             FirstSeen = column_ifexists('first_seen_s', ''),
             LastSeen = column_ifexists('last_seen_s', ''),
             Category = column_ifexists('category_s', ''),
             Description = column_ifexists('description_s', ''),
             AssetName = column_ifexists('asset_name_s', ''),
             AssetType = column_ifexists('asset_type_s', ''),
             Port = toint(column_ifexists('port_d', 0)),
             Protocol = column_ifexists('protocol_s', ''),
             IpAddress = column_ifexists('ip_address_s', ''),
             Technology = column_ifexists('technology_s', ''),
             Cve = column_ifexists('cve_s', ''),
             CvssScore = toreal(column_ifexists('cvss_score_d', 0.0)),
             Remediation = column_ifexists('remediation_s', ''),
             References = column_ifexists('references_s', ''),
             Tags = column_ifexists('tags_s', ''),
             Priority = column_ifexists('priority_s', ''),
             AssignedTo = column_ifexists('assigned_to_s', ''),
             Notes = column_ifexists('notes_s', ''),
             ExternalLink = column_ifexists('external_link_s', ''),
             CreatedAt = column_ifexists('created_at_s', ''),
             UpdatedAt = column_ifexists('updated_at_s', '');
let HackerViewV2_view = HackerViewLog_AzureV2_CL
    | extend EventVendor = 'CTM360',
             EventProduct = 'HackerView',
             SourceConnector = 'CCF';
union isfuzzy=true HackerViewV2_view, HackerViewV1_view
| project TimeGenerated, EventVendor, EventProduct, SourceConnector, IssueId, Title, Severity, Status, FirstSeen, LastSeen, Category, Description, AssetName, AssetType, Port, Protocol, IpAddress, Technology, Cve, CvssScore, Remediation, References, Tags, Priority, AssignedTo, Notes, ExternalLink, CreatedAt, UpdatedAt
| project-away *_s, *_d

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

Review the solution Release Notes

There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The HACKERVIEW and CBS solutions for Microsoft Sentinel enable you to ingest their respective event data into Microsoft Sentinel using the REST API. This integration streamlines the process of collecting and analyzing security event information. With these solutions, you can enhance your organization's ability to detect and respond to potential security threats effectively.

HACKERVIEW

HACKERVIEW is CTM360s External Attack Surface Management platform. It combines automated asset discovery, issue identification/management, remediation guidelines, security ratings, and third-party risk management. This platform maps your organizations digital presence automatically, operating in a passive and non-intrusive manner leveraging data in the public domain.

CyberBlindspot

CyberBlindspot is CTM360 Digital Risk Protection platform which combines surface, deep, and dark web monitoring, including brand protection, anti-phishing, and takedowns. The platform enables you to take action on incidents derived from threat intelligence that is directly linked to your organization.

Data Connectors: 2, Parsers: 7, Analytic Rules: 240
